segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
4. Kaḷāra the Aristocrat
34. Grounds for Knowledge (2nd)
At Sāvatthī.
“Mendicants, I will teach seventy-seven grounds for knowledge.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:
“And what are the seventy-seven grounds for knowledge?
The knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death,
and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.

segments.pli: atītampi addhānaṃ jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ;
segments.en: Also regarding the past: the knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death, and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.

segments.pli: anāgatampi addhānaṃ jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti ñāṇaṃ;
segments.en: Also regarding the future: the knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death, and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.

segments.pli: yampissa taṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ tampi khayadhammaṃ vayadhammaṃ virāgadhammaṃ nirodhadhammanti ñāṇaṃ.
segments.en: And also their knowledge that even this knowledge of the stability of natural principles is liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
The knowledge that continued existence is a condition for rebirth …

segments.pli: avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ, asati avijjāya natthi saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ;
segments.en: The knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.

segments.pli: atītampi addhānaṃ avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ, asati avijjāya natthi saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ;
segments.en: Also regarding the past: the knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.

segments.pli: anāgatampi addhānaṃ avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ, asati avijjāya natthi saṅkhārāti ñāṇaṃ;
segments.en: Also regarding the future: the knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.

segments.pli: yampissa taṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ tampi khayadhammaṃ vayadhammaṃ virāgadhammaṃ nirodhadhammanti ñāṇaṃ.
segments.en: And also their knowledge that even this knowledge of the stability of natural principles is liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
These are called the seventy-seven grounds for knowledge.”
